headline: No Egg Chocolate Mug Cake
description: This easy eggless mug cake is made with cocoa powder, chocolate chips, and sliced almonds. It cooks in the microwave in just 3 minutes or less.

video.name: No Egg Chocolate Mug Cake Recipe

name: No Egg Chocolate Mug Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, milk, cocoa powder, olive oil, and baking powder in a large mug until well combined. Stir in chocolate chips and almonds.
Place mug in the microwave and cook until cake has risen by 50 percent, 30 seconds to 2 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I think it‚Äôs pretty good it tastes alright I guess but could be better 3/5
Needed more milk than listed besides that so goood
It just went hard and horrible I have made loads of mug cakes but this one was not good

Everyone in our family LOVED it! I substituted Dark Chocolate and added some chopped maraschino cherries instead of regular chocolate and sliced almonds, for a cherry chocolate valentines treat, and a pinch of vanilla extract & sea salt. Love how this does not use eggs and is fast and easy!
super easy and delicious. i measured everything really roughly, and did half the sugar which came out perfect. only had to do two bursts of 30s in the microwave, and that was it!

This is delicious. I needed to add a bit more milk , but if you watch the video you can see what consistency it should be. I didn't have almonds so I used chopped hazelnuts. We had icecream on top. My partner was in cake heaven!
Awful texture. Didn't bake all the way through with 1.5 mins of baking time. Some was too baked, some still wet.
Bit more milk needed, add some vanilla essence and it was banging.
Great for a quick cake if you are craving something sweet and you have nothing in üëçüëç
the taste of this mug cake was a 2/10 it tasted like burned flour and cocoa powder, i cooked it for the correct time and everything. It rose but it tasted really bad
The results are very good I didn't have almonds and olive oil So I used cooking oil and it was great
It didn't rise it was like warm cookie dough not cake
OK I'm so confused everyone's saying there's at least something wrong with it, mine was perfect and I don't even really like cake I don't know whats going on.
did not work at all was spongy and did not cook all the way even if I kept microwaving it.
I baked it for 2 mins on 800W,and added a little bit more milk.It turned out pretty good for an eggless microwave muffin
I did add almonds but holy cow! This is the best mug cake I've ever made! Thanks!!
It was OK but the taste didn‚Äôt really compared to how a regular chocolate cake would be.
I used bread flour instead of all purpose flour
Easy
It worked well

Made it according to recipe, but cut in half for a smaller single serving. Microwaved for three 30 second increments and it came out cake like. Very tasty. I would like more of a molten type of texture, so will cut down to three 25 second increments. Perfect single serving size.
I made three different ones one almond,one peppermint, and one peanut.
It was a fast and easy recipe to make, although the batter was sticky and hard to stir. It is also kind of flavorless, but not bad for a no egg recipe!
It was great!!!
Yummy I say ?? ??
Love it with a side of vanilla icecream!

I used GF plain flour and brown sugar - left out the almonds. This was for allergy reasons, my daughter loved it - Thanks for the inspiration I would leave a photo but she ate it before I could take one
Unbelievably delectable. Whole famiy loved it.
The recipe was very good, and the mug cake turned out very tasty. I will be very happy to make this mug cake again.
It was a volcanic mess in the microwave and remained liquidy. Tasted delicious though
It was very good but WAYYYYY sweet. I would change the amount of sugar if i ever make it again. And the time didnt work 2 minutes wasn't enough.
Cook for 2mins 30secs
First ever mug cake that I made that had the consistency of a cake! It was a little flavorless tho, would have liked it if it was a bit sweeter but overall it was good!
It was easy and quick but a bit rubbery
Wow it‚Äôs delicious! I may have cooked it just a tad too long but it‚Äôs still really really good! I topped mine with sliced bananas. Will definitely make again when I need a chocolate fix.

Super yum recipe! Especially when it's warm.
I followed advice of other reviews here and used coconut oil instead of olive oil. I also didn't have any choc chips but I imagine they'd just make it better.
I microwaved it for 30 secs to melt the oil, stirred it, then microwaved for another 2 min.
I just stabbed it with my spoon to make sure it was cooked. 
The recipe makes quite a lot. I used one of my bigger mugs.
I love this! This is the first of many mug cakes I‚Äôve made that has the texture of a fudge brownie. I substituted Swerve for the sugar and almond flour for the all-purpose gluten free flour.
DISAPPOINTED AND DISGUSTED DO NOT MAKE!!

I have made many mug cakes and this one might be okay if you make some adjustments.:
I used the olive oil but I think I would try another type of oil if I make it again.
But the main problem is cooking time as others have commented. 30 second to 2 minutes (because our microwave aren‚Äôt the same! 
I did mine for 60 seconds on medium power and mine was still mud in the middle. I then cooked it on regular power for a minute and it was overdone.

When I made this recipe, it didn't even cook... I put it in for 65 seconds, then again for a minute. When I took it out the second time, the top had a "crust" so to speak, and the inside was total fudge. The taste was okay.... I was just disappointed that it was "fudge" not cake...
Im making it again

I made a lot of changes and was surprised how well it turned out.
I subbed 1/2 the flour for coconut flour, 1/2 the sugar with stevia, and used cashew milk & vegetable oil. 

I cooked mine for 3 instances of 40 seconds each time.

It came out more like a warm fudge, but tastes marvelous.

I have made this recipe three times, and it makes enough for two people. I took another reviewer‚Äôs recommendation and used coconut oil instead of olive oil. I tried this recipe with chocolate chips and peanut butter chips. Of the two, I preferred the chocolate chips.
It tasted kind flavorless to me. But overall, it was OK.

I honestly LOVED this recipe! it is such an easy way to make a cake! Whoever made this up is a genius! Whenever a friend is over and they want to make something with me I always use this as my first option because it is soooo delicious! I know all of you would like it too!!!

I have made other kinds of mug cakes and this one is the best one so far. Instead of topping it with powder sugar, I topped it with vanilla ice cream. I also added no almonds. The cake is very good and I recommend making it!

I didn't have any on hand, so I didn't use chocolate chips or almonds.
The resulting cake was somewhat dry, but palatable. 
Although you can omit the chocolate chips, I feel like it would be a lot better with them.
Next time I want to make a mug cake I will use this recipe, it's defiantly worth a try. Just use chocolate chips.
Update: I made it a second time, but with slight changed to the recipe.
As I last said, I didn't use the chocolate chips or almond flakes.
I substituted olive oil (last time it had a bit of an olive oil taste) with coconut oil (equal amount), and added a bit of water, maybe about a tablespoon.
This drastically improved the recipe. I would pair it with whipped cream, ice cream, and add chocolate chips if I had any of those, but with the changes I made it tasted way better!
I didn't add the almonds bc my family doesn't like nuts. the olive oil did make a flavor change. t probably would have tasted better without the olive oil.
It is ammmaaaaaazzzzeeee!!!

I made this, but with healthier substitutions to see if it would still come out good. I used coconut sugar instead of white sugar, almond milk instead of cow's milk, coconut oil instead of olive oil. I also used dark cocoa because that is all I had. I cooked for 50 seconds. The result was great. I will never use eggs again for my mug cakes. Next time, I will try it with oat flour instead of wheat flour to make it gluten free :)

Don‚Äôt know what I made but it was NOT. a mug cake ?? maybe I left it in the microwave too long. But yeah it was a disaster and now my kitchen smells like it‚Äôs on fire ?? it‚Äôs literally not even edible.

So I've made a lot of mug cakes and these instructions are not right. I put the solid ingredients in first, used a 1/4 tsp for the baking powder, and then the liquid ingredients. I didn't understand the cooking time. 30 seconds to 2 minutes??? I put it in there for 50 seconds and it looks like a middle school volcano project for the science fair made out of chocolate so that's something
SO good, I just added some extra chocolate chips on top, no almonds, it was the best thing ever!
